required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Plasmapheresis on Aging Biomarkers
clinical_study.official_title: Studie Vlivu darování krevní Plazmy - Plasmapheresis. Study of the Plasma Donation Effect - Plasmapheresis

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to evaluate the effect of plasmapheresis (repeated plasma withdrawals) on selected health indicators (hematological, biochemical, immunological and indicators of biological age) of plasma donors.

primary_outcome.measure: Significant change of biological age according to epigenetic clock after 8 plasmaphereses
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 months
primary_outcome.description: Significant change of the epigenetic age of the plasma donors after 8 cycles of plasmapheresis conducted or a slower increase of the biological age throughout the study than the increase of the chronological age.

secondary_outcome.measure: Significant change of biological age according to epigenetic clock after 8 plasmaphereses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 months
secondary_outcome.description: Significant change of the epigenetic age of the plasma donors after 4 cycles of plasmapheresis conducted or a slower increase of the biological age throughout the study than the increase of the chronological age.

secondary_outcome.measure: Significant change of the proteomic profile after 8 plasmaphereses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 months
secondary_outcome.description: Proteomic analysis showing signs of a rejuvenated proteostasis in the plasma donors after 8 cycles of plasmapheresis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Significant change of the proteomic profile after 4 plasmaphereses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 months
secondary_outcome.description: Proteomic analysis showing signs of a rejuvenated proteostasis in the plasma donors after 8 cycles of plasmapheresis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Significant change of the biological age according to a blood biochemistry clock after 8 plasmaphereses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood biochemistry clock showing phenotype of a younger individual in the plasma donors after 8 cycles of plasmapheresis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Significant change of the biological age according to a blood biochemistry clock after 4 plasmaphereses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood biochemistry clock showing phenotype of a younger individual in the plasma donors after 8 cycles of plasmapheresis.

arm_group.description: Group 1 consists of first time donors undergoing all 8 tracked plasmaphereses.
Group 2 consists of first time donors undergoing only last 4 plasmaphereses, serving as control for the first 4 donations.

intervention.description: Procedure whereby plasma is separated and extracted from anticoagulated whole blood and the red cells retransfused to the donor.

study_pop.textblock:
41 donors are welcomed to begin with the study. The participants are divided into 2 groups (Group 1 = therapeutic, Group 2 = half control) using stratified randomization, major criteria being chronological age and BMI, minor criteria being illness/medication, smoking, COVID in past 3 months, covid vaccination.
Group 1 consists of 28 participants (14 female, 14 male). Group 2 consists of 13 participants (7 female, 6 male). We suppose that the number of participants will decline during each phase of the study, approx. 10% before it even starts, 10% in the middle, 10% in the end. The goal is to have more than 30 participants finishing the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Generally healthy volunteer subjects age 40 - 60
2. 50:50 man and woman
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects excluded from plasma donation protocols (serious illness, infection, etc)
2. Subjects undergoing stronger anti-aging interventions

facility.name: Charles University, Medical Faculty in Hradec Kralove
